paper_abstract: The next generation of smart grid technologies demands intelligent capabilities for communication, interaction, monitoring, storage, and energy transmission. Multi-agent systems are envisioned to provide autonomic and adaptability features to these systems in order to gain advantage in their current environments. In this article we present a mechanism for providing distributed energy storage systems (DESSs) with intelligent capabilities. In more detail, we propose a self-configurable mechanism that allows a DESS to adapt itself according to the future environmental requirements. This mechanism is aimed at reducing the costs at which energy is purchased from the market.
paper_title: AN INTELLIGENT SELF-CONFIGURABLE MECHANISM FOR DISTRIBUTED ENERGY STORAGE SYSTEMS
